meanings.sent1: They decided to renegotiate the contract for better terms.
meanings.sent2: The two parties will meet next week to renegotiate the deal.
meanings.sent3: The team had to renegotiate their strategy after facing unexpected challenges.
meanings.sent4: She renegotiated her daily routine to include more exercise.
meanings.sent5: The students had to renegotiate their group project timeline to meet the deadline.

meanings.definition: The act of discussing terms again
meanings.sent1: The renegotiation of the agreement took longer than expected.
meanings.sent2: There was a lot of back-and-forth during the renegotiation process.
meanings.sent3: The renegotiation of the lease terms was a tedious task.
meanings.sent4: The union demanded a renegotiation of the employee benefits.
meanings.sent5: The renegotiation of the loan terms was necessary to avoid default.

meanings.sent1: They plan to renegotiate the terms of their partnership.
meanings.sent2: After much debate, they finally agreed to renegotiate the conditions.
meanings.sent3: The siblings had to renegotiate the rules of their game to make it fair.
meanings.sent4: The company decided to renegotiate the pricing with their suppliers.
meanings.sent5: It was necessary to renegotiate the terms of the contract to ensure fairness.
